conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway: walls have height/thickness, interior volume is readable, and the ceiling/roof is removed; camera is near top-down but still shows 3D wall faces and shadows.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D wall solids with thickness and clean cutaway; view is slightly too top-down to be strongly isometric, but still clearly 3D with multiple wall surfaces visible.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall core layout (living/kitchen/dining/study/bedrooms/master suite/hall/baths) broadly matches, but the 2-car garage from the 2D plan is not represented in the 3D render (major program/room omission), and some exterior/covered-patio extents appear reduced/omitted.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture and fixtures are present (beds, seating, dining, kitchen counters/appliances, toilets/sinks/tub) and placed plausibly within corresponding rooms.

visual_clarity.notes: Clear separation of walls/floors/openings with good lighting and minimal artifacts; presentation is clean and readable.

detected_errors.description: 2-car garage shown in the 2D plan (large bottom-right zone) is missing/not modeled in the 3D render.
Resulting footprint/program distribution differs from the 2D plan due to the missing garage area, reducing layout fidelity in that region.
Camera is close to top-down; less isometric depth cueing than expected, though still a valid 3D cutaway.

summary: A genuine 3D cutaway with strong modeling and interiors, but it fails strict plan fidelity primarily due to the missing 2-car garage (major room/program omission).
